questions.question: Where can you store files in AWS? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS (Elastic File System) and Amazon EBS (Elastic Block Store) are both storage services. EFS provides scalable file storage, while EBS provides block storage for EC2. SNS, ECS, and EMR are not storage services.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to store and reliably deliver messages across distributed systems?
questions.explanation: Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service) allows you to reliably deliver messages across distributed systems. It is designed for decoupling and buffering messages between components.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the payment model that AWS makes available for customers that can commit to using Amazon EC2 over a one or 3-year term to reduce their total computing costs?
questions.explanation: The model 'Save when you reserve' refers to Reserved Instances, which provide a lower cost in exchange for a 1 or 3-year commitment.

questions.question: A company is migrating its on-premises database to Amazon RDS. What should the company do to ensure Amazon RDS costs are kept to a minimum?

options.text: Combine On-demand Capacity Reservations with Saving Plans.

questions.explanation: Right-sizing means choosing the most cost-efficient instance types before and after migration to avoid overprovisioning and keep RDS costs low.

questions.question: What is the primary storage service used by Amazon RDS database instances?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS primarily uses Amazon EBS for storage of databases. EBS volumes provide reliable block storage.

questions.question: A company is developing a new application using a microservices framework. The new application is having performance and latency issues. Which AWS Service should be used to troubleshoot these issues?
questions.explanation: AWS X-Ray helps developers analyze and debug distributed applications, identifying bottlenecks and latency issues.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS services is designed with native Multi-AZ fault tolerance in mind? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 and DynamoDB are designed for native multi-AZ fault tolerance. Data is automatically replicated across AZs for high availability.

questions.question: What are the Amazon RDS features that can be used to improve the availability of your database? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Multi-AZ deployments provide failover support, while Read Replicas improve availability by allowing read scaling.

questions.question: Sarah has deployed an application in the Northern California (us-west-1) region. After examining the application’s traffic, she notices that about 30% of the traffic is coming from Asia. What can she do to reduce latency for the users in Asia?

options.text: Replicate the current resources across multiple Availability Zones within the same region.
Migrate the application to a hosting provider in Asia.
Create a CDN using CloudFront, so that content is cached at Edge Locations close to and in Asia.

questions.explanation: CloudFront distributes cached content at edge locations worldwide, reducing latency for users in Asia.

questions.question: An organization runs many systems and uses many AWS products. Which of the following services enables them to control how each developer interacts with these products?
questions.explanation: IAM controls access and permissions for AWS users, groups, and roles, allowing you to manage developer interactions with resources.

questions.question: Using Amazon EC2 falls under which of the following cloud computing models?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 is an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), providing virtual servers without managing physical infrastructure.

questions.question: Which of the below is a best-practice when building applications on AWS?

options.text: Strengthen physical security by applying the principle of least privilege.
Ensure that the application runs on hardware from trusted vendors.
Use IAM policies to maintain performance.
Decouple the components of the application so that they run independently.

questions.explanation: Decoupling components ensures better resilience and scalability, as failures in one component don’t affect others.

questions.question: Your company is designing a new application that will store and retrieve photos and videos. Which of the following services should you recommend as the underlying storage mechanism?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is the best option for storing and retrieving unstructured data such as photos and videos.

questions.question: Amazon Glacier is an Amazon S3 storage class that is suitable for storing [...] & [...]. (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Glacier is designed for long-term, infrequently accessed data such as archives and analytics datasets.

questions.question: What does Amazon Elastic Beanstalk provide?

options.text: A PaaS solution to automate application deployment.
A compute engine for Amazon ECS.
A scalable file storage solution for use with AWS and on-premises servers.

questions.explanation: Elastic Beanstalk is a PaaS service that automates the deployment of applications while managing scaling and monitoring.

questions.question: What is the AWS service that performs automated network assessments of Amazon EC2 instances to check for vulnerabilities?
questions.explanation: Amazon Inspector performs automated security and vulnerability assessments for EC2 instances.

questions.question: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following controls do customers fully inherit from AWS? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Customers inherit AWS's physical and environmental controls (data center security, power, cooling), while AWS customers manage logical security.

questions.question: A company needs to host a database in Amazon RDS for at least three years. Which of the following options would be the most cost-effective solution?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances with partial upfront payment provide the best balance of long-term savings for RDS workloads.

questions.question: Your application has recently experienced significant global growth, and international users are complaining of high latency. What is the AWS characteristic that can help improve your international users’ experience?
questions.explanation: Global reach allows AWS to deploy resources close to users worldwide, reducing latency.

questions.question: Savings Plans are available for which of the following AWS compute services? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Savings Plans apply to Amazon EC2 and AWS Lambda, reducing costs in exchange for usage commitment.

questions.question: A company has business critical workloads hosted on AWS and they are unwilling to accept any downtime. Which of the following is a recommended best practice to protect their workloads in the event of an unexpected natural disaster?

options.text: Replicate data across multiple Edge Locations worldwide and use Amazon CloudFront to perform automatic failover in the event of an outage.
Deploy AWS resources across multiple Availability Zones within the same AWS Region.
Create point-in-time backups in another subnet and recover this data when a disaster occurs.
Deploy AWS resources to another AWS Region and implement an Active-Active disaster recovery strategy.

questions.explanation: Active-Active multi-region deployment ensures workloads remain available even during a regional disaster.

questions.question: Which statement is correct with regards to AWS service limits? (Choose TWO)

options.text: You can contact AWS support to increase the service limits.
Each IAM user has the same service limit.
There are no service limits on AWS.
You can use the AWS Trusted Advisor to monitor your service limits.
The Amazon Simple Email Service is responsible for sending email notifications when usage approaches a service limit.

questions.explanation: Service limits can be increased by contacting support and monitored via Trusted Advisor.

questions.question: What is the AWS tool that enables you to use scripts to manage all AWS services and resources?
questions.explanation: AWS CLI allows you to use scripts to automate and manage AWS services programmatically.

questions.question: What are the connectivity options that can be used to build hybrid cloud architectures? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Direct Connect and AWS VPN are the primary hybrid connectivity solutions linking on-premises with AWS.

questions.question: A company has deployed a new web application on multiple Amazon EC2 instances. Which of the following should they use to ensure that the incoming HTTP traffic is distributed evenly across the instances?
questions.explanation: An Application Load Balancer distributes HTTP(S) traffic across multiple EC2 instances for scalability and fault tolerance.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS offerings is a MySQL-compatible relational database service that can scale capacity automatically based on demand?
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL-compatible database service with automatic scaling for performance and availability.

questions.question: Which of the following can help protect your EC2 instances from DDoS attacks? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Security Groups and Network ACLs provide layered network protection and mitigate risks from DDoS attacks.

questions.question: What is the AWS data warehouse service that supports a high level of query performance on large amounts of datasets?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is AWS’s data warehouse service optimized for running complex queries on large datasets.

questions.question: Which of the following should be considered when performing a TCO analysis to compare the costs of running an application on AWS instead of on-premises?
questions.explanation: TCO analysis compares costs like physical hardware between on-premises and cloud-based deployments.

questions.question: How are AWS customers billed for Linux-based Amazon EC2 usage?

options.text: EC2 instances will be billed on one second increments, with a minimum of one minute.
EC2 instances will be billed on one hour increments, with a minimum of one day.
EC2 instances will be billed on one minute increments, with a minimum of one hour.
EC2 instances will be billed on one day increments, with a minimum of one month.

questions.explanation: Linux EC2 instances are billed per second with a minimum of one minute, offering fine-grained billing.

questions.question: Which of the following will impact the price paid for an EC2 instance? (Choose TWO)

options.text: The Availability Zone where the instance is provisioned.

questions.explanation: The cost of EC2 depends on factors like instance type and the region/AZ, which affect pricing.

questions.question: A customer spent a lot of time configuring a newly deployed Amazon EC2 instance. After the workload increases, the customer decides to provision another EC2 instance with an identical configuration. How can the customer achieve this?

options.text: By creating an AWS Config template from the old instance and launching a new instance from it.
By creating an EBS Snapshot of the old instance.
By installing Aurora on EC2 and launching a new instance from it.
By creating an AMI from the old instance and launching a new instance from it.

questions.explanation: You can create an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) of a configured EC2 instance to replicate it quickly.

questions.question: A company uses AWS Organizations to manage all of its AWS accounts. Which of the following allows the company to restrict what services and actions are allowed in each individual account?
questions.explanation: AWS Service Control Policies (SCPs) within AWS Organizations allow restricting services and actions per account.

questions.question: Which of the following statements describes the AWS Cloud’s agility?

options.text: AWS allows you to host your applications in multiple regions around the world.
AWS provides customizable hardware at the lowest possible cost.
AWS allows you to provision resources in minutes.
AWS allows you to pay upfront to reduce costs.

questions.explanation: Agility in AWS means the ability to provision resources in minutes instead of weeks or months.

questions.question: What are the benefits of using the Amazon Relational Database Service? (Choose TWO)

options.text: Complete control over the underlying host.
Scales automatically to larger or smaller instance types.
Supports the document and key-value data structure.

questions.explanation: Amazon RDS reduces admin tasks like backups and patching, while also providing resizable compute capacity.

questions.question: What is the connectivity option that uses Internet Protocol Security (IPSec) to establish encrypted connectivity between an on-premises network and the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: AWS Site-to-Site VPN uses IPSec to securely connect on-premises networks to AWS.

questions.question: What is the minimum level of AWS support that provides 24x7 access to technical support engineers via phone and chat?
questions.explanation: Business Support provides 24x7 access to technical engineers via phone and chat, unlike Developer or Basic plans.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to control network traffic in AWS? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: NACLs and Security Groups control inbound/outbound traffic at the subnet and instance levels respectively.

questions.question: A company has developed a media transcoding application in AWS. The application is designed to recover quickly from hardware failures. Which one of the following types of instance would be the most cost-effective choice to use?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are the most cost-effective choice for workloads that can tolerate interruptions and recover from failures.

questions.question: Which AWS Service provides the current status of all AWS Services in all AWS Regions?
questions.explanation: The AWS Service Health Dashboard provides current global status of AWS services.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can be used to call AWS Services from different programming languages?
questions.explanation: AWS SDKs allow you to interact with AWS services from programming languages such as Python, Java, and Node.js.

questions.question: Which AWS Service can be used to register a new domain name?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 provides domain registration and DNS services.

questions.question: App development companies move their business to AWS to reduce time-to-market and improve customer satisfaction, what are the AWS automation tools that help them deploy their applications faster? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: CloudFormation (infrastructure as code) and Elastic Beanstalk (app deployment) automate and accelerate app delivery.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides cost-optimization recommendations?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor gives recommendations for cost optimization, security, performance, and fault tolerance.

questions.question: A company has hundreds of VPCs in multiple AWS Regions worldwide. What service does AWS offer to simplify the connection management among the VPCs?
questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway simplifies connectivity by acting as a hub for multiple VPCs and on-premises networks.

questions.question: What is one benefit and one drawback of buying a reserved EC2 instance? (Select TWO)

options.text: Instances can be shut down by AWS at any time with no notification.
Reserved instances require at least a one-year pricing commitment.
There is no additional charge for using dedicated instances.
Reserved instances provide a significant discount compared to on-demand instances.

questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide significant cost savings (advantage), but require at least a one-year commitment (drawback).

questions.question: Why does every AWS Region contain multiple Availability Zones?

options.text: Multiple Availability Zones allows you to build resilient and highly available architectures.
Multiple Availability Zones results in lower total cost compared to deploying in a single Availability Zone.
Multiple Availability Zones allows for data replication and global reach.
Multiple Availability Zones within a region increases the storage capacity available in that region.

questions.explanation: Multiple Availability Zones in a region allow resilient, highly available architectures.

questions.question: What is the most cost-effective purchasing option for running a set of EC2 instances that must always be available for a period of two months?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances are most cost-effective for short-term workloads that must always be available (2 months).

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of running an application in multiple Availability Zones?

options.text: Allows you to exceed AWS service limits.
Reduces application response time between servers and global users.
Increases the availability of your application.

questions.explanation: Running across multiple AZs increases fault tolerance and ensures higher availability for applications.

questions.question: Data security is one of the top priorities of AWS. How does AWS deal with old storage devices that have reached the end of their useful life?

options.text: AWS sells the old devices to other hosting providers.
AWS destroys the old devices in accordance with industry-standard practices.
AWS sends the old devices for remanufacturing.
AWS stores the old devices in a secure place.

questions.explanation: AWS securely destroys old storage devices following industry-standard practices to protect customer data.
